intro: Gymnosporia jinyangensis, commonly known as the Yinyang Mountain gymnosporia, is a shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody fruits containing seeds. It is typically found in rocky or mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
